gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls
Class CursorOutputControl

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container

All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, IViewControl, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class CursorOutputControl
extends ViewControl

This class is a ViewControl (ActiveJPanel) with text fields set up for cursor output.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

LABELS

public static final java.lang.String LABELS
"Labels" - This String key refers to the labels displayed in the CursorOutputControls. This ObjectState key references a String[n][m]. If only a 1-D set of names is given, the array is String[n][1].

See Also:
Constant Field Values

VALUES

public static final java.lang.String VALUES
"Values" - This String key refers to the values displayed in the CursorOutputControls. This ObjectState key references a float[n][m]. If only a 1-D set of names is given, the array is float[n][1].

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

CursorOutputControl

public CursorOutputControl(java.lang.String[] name)
The Constructor initilizes the values for the cursor output, and sets the headings and the border. Use this constructor for a 1-D column of textfields.

Parameters:
name - A 1-D array of strings which are the names of the text fields which display the cursor output in a column.

CursorOutputControl

public CursorOutputControl(java.lang.String[][] name)
The Constructor initilizes the values for the cursor output, and sets the headings and the border. Use this constructor for a 2-D array of textfields.

Parameters:
name - A 2-D array of strings which are the names of the text fields which display the cursor output in rows and columns.

getObjectState

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean is_default)
Get the current state of this view control.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IViewControl
Overrides:
getObjectState in class ViewControl
Parameters:
is_default - Use IPreserveState.PROJECT or DEFAULT as a parameter.
Returns:
If PROJECT, the entire state is returned. If DEFAULT, only information related to user preferences is returned.

setValue

public void setValue(int index,
                     float value)
This function sets the value to be displayed in the text field.

Parameters:
index - The int which represents the text field for the value to be displayed in, on interval [0,num_textfields - 1].
value - The floating point value to be displayed.

setValue

public void setValue(int row,
                     int col,
                     float value)
This function sets the value to be displayed in the text field for a 2-D group of textfields.

Parameters:
row - The row number of this textfield, on interval [0,#rows-1]
col - The column number of this textfield, on interval [0,#cols-1]
value - The floating point value to be displayed.

getValue

public float getValue(int index)
This function gets the value displayed in the text field.

Parameters:
index - The int which represents the text field for the value to be displayed in, on interval [0,num_textfields - 1].
Returns:
Returns a float value displayed in text field. If index is invalid, Float.NaN is returned.

getValue

public float getValue(int row,
                      int col)
This function gets the value displayed in a text field that is part of a 2-D group of textfields.

Parameters:
row - The row number of this textfield, on interval [0,#rows-1]
col - The column number of this textfield, on interval [0,#cols-1]
Returns:
The floating point value displayed by the text field. If the row or col is invalid, Float.NaN is returned.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Test purposes only... If "cm" is passed as an argument, the ControlManager will link controls.
